content: The "Heavy Truck Tax Fairness Act of 2010" repeals the excise tax on heavy trucks and trailers. The Heavy Truck Tax Fairness Act of 2010 repeals the excise tax on heavy trucks and trailers, with corresponding amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Heavy Truck Tax Fairness Act of 2010 makes several amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including changes to sections 4222(d), 4293, 6416(b)(6), and 9503(b)(1). The effective date for these amendments is specified. The amendments made by the Heavy Truck Tax Fairness Act of 2010 apply to articles sold after the enactment date of the Act. SEC. 3. INCREASE IN TAX ON DIESEL FUEL OR KEROSENE. The amendment increases the tax on fuel from 24.3 cents to 31.6 cents per gallon. The amendment applies to fuel removed, entered, or sold after the enactment date. A floor stocks tax is imposed on taxable liquid held on a specific date, with the tax calculated based on the difference between the tax on that date and the tax previously paid. Liability for tax on liquid held on floor stocks tax date. Person holding liquid liable for tax imposed. Payment method prescribed by Secretary. Tax to be paid 6 months after tax date. Liquid considered held if title passed to person. The tax imposed on taxable liquid does not apply to certain exempt uses or fuel held in a vehicle tank. The tax on taxable liquid in a motor vehicle or motorboat tank does not apply if the amount held does not exceed 2,000 gallons on the floor stocks tax date, and the person submits required information to the Secretary. Fuel exempt from the tax is not considered for this purpose. Controlled groups for tax purposes are treated as one person, with the definition based on ownership of more than 50 percent of a corporation. The text discusses the application of tax laws to floor stock taxes imposed by chapters 31 or 32 of the Code, with regulations for groups of nonincorporated persons under common control.
